Laura [JACCH NON-J&J];Baluguri, Mamatha [JRDUS NON-J&J]
Description:
Meeting recurrence has been updated to every 2 weeks

 

A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

Description:
Meeting recurrence has been updated to every 2 weeks

 

A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Annemie Van Dijk <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> , Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com>  or Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Annemie Van Dijk <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> , Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com>  or Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

Meeting recurrence has been updated to every 2 weeks

 

A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Annemie Van Dijk <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> , Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com>  or Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

 

Zoom Meeting information

Meeting ID:

926 0729 3054

Password:

166845

Join the meeting <https://jnjmeetings.zoom.us/j/92607293054?pwd=aHBZM2MxK3ZtVEloaUxOV1FVMFZ2dz09> 

 

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

We look forward to helping you with your smooth transition to SPACE!

Description:
A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

IDAR C&SP

 

C&SP Communications – SPACE Walk/Talk

 

 

Dear SPACE Explorers,

 

Thank you for your participation and interactions in our SPACE sessions.

 

SPACE has been launched and more than 240 colleagues have been granted SPACE production access, so the need to go in more detail on SPACE items & Business Process updates related to SPACE is even bigger than before.

Note that the info provided in these communications is not covered in the standard SPACE Training.

 

On the SPACE portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/SPACE_COMM/SitePages/SPACE-Walk-%26-Talks.aspx>  via the SPACE Walk & Talk tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/SPACE_COMM/SitePages/SPACE-Walk-%26-Talks.aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics that are in a waiting list to be planned
*	the topics for the next SPACE Walk & Talk sessions
*	the topics that were covered in previous sessions
	(on the right hand side of the page there is a folder for each session holding the presentations and the recordings of the session)

Subject: R Walk - APAC/EU
Required Attendees: DL-GD-IDAR-SP-AI-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-EU-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-LT;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-PortfolioLead-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-US-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-XLT;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-CN-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-JPKK-JNJ;DL-GD-SDS-JNJ
Description:
A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Alex Cheng <mailto:ccheng36@its.jnj.com>  , Yufan Chen <mailto:ychen209@its.jnj.com> , Lucy Sutton <mailto:lsutton1@its.jnj.com>  , Tina Liu <mailto:jliu193@its.jnj.com>  or Annemie Van Dijck <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> 

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

Required Attendees: DL-GD-IDAR-SP-AI-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-EU-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-LT;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-PortfolioLead-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-US-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-XLT;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-CN-JNJ;DL-GD-IDAR-SP-JPKK-JNJ;DL-GD-SDS-JNJ
Description:
A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Alex Cheng <mailto:ccheng36@its.jnj.com>  , Yufan Chen <mailto:ychen209@its.jnj.com> , Lucy Sutton <mailto:lsutton1@its.jnj.com>  , Tina Liu <mailto:jliu193@its.jnj.com>  or Annemie Van Dijck <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> 

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

Hey Yufan


Since agenda’s tend to be blocked rapidly … I hope you are fine with this bi-weekly placeholder meeting on Tuesdays?

Off course, if needed … we can always organize adhoc meetings but … I think it is good to have at least a bi-weekly placeholder in place.

Looking forward working with you on this project!

 

Speak you soon!

Jeroen

Description:
Meeting recurrence has been updated to every 2 weeks

 

A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Annemie Van Dijk <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> , Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com>  or Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

R-walk session

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Annemie Van Dijk <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> , Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com>  or Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

Description:
Meeting recurrence has been updated to every 2 weeks

 

A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Annemie Van Dijk <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> , Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com>  or Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Annemie Van Dijk <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> , Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com>  or Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

Subject: R Walk - Non J&J - APAC/EU
Required Attendees: DL-GD-IDAR-SP-nonJNJ;DL-GD-SDS-FLEX-MBSM-ALL
Description:
A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Now that R has been integrated in the SPACE platform, more and more people are starting to use R for their day to day work. The Early Adopters are exploring the tidytlg package and using R for production outputs. Everybody can use R for QC of outputs in their own studies. In the R-walk sessions, we provide a platform to strengthen our Community of Practice. There is room for sharing of experiences, we will give small trainings on focused topics, updates on process changes related to the use of R and all your R-related questions. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

On the R portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal>  via the R-Walks tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics for the next R Walk sessions
*	the topics and material that was covered in previous sessions
*	a link to provide suggestions for upcoming topics (what do YOU want to hear in the next sessions?)

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our R Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


You can choose between the APAC/EU and US/EU session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation. 

 

 

If you have any questions please contact Alex Cheng <mailto:ccheng36@its.jnj.com>  , Yufan Chen <mailto:ychen209@its.jnj.com> , Lucy Sutton <mailto:lsutton1@its.jnj.com>  , Tina Liu <mailto:jliu193@its.jnj.com>  or Annemie Van Dijck <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> 

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

Optional Attendees: Sheng, Jingli Doris [JRDCN];Liu, Xu (Eiffel)  [JRDCN];Wu, Xiongying(Emily) [JRDCN];Tan, Ruofeng [JRDCN];Huang, Ying (Fairy) [JRDCN];You, Jialin [JRDCN];Wang, Xiaoqing [JRDCN];Xu, Hanqiu melody [JRDCN NON-J&J];Yan, Ritta [HRCN];Lin, Yanhua [JRDCN]
Description:
Dear colleagues, 

A warm welcome again to our Janssen China R&D family! 

One of the most exciting challenges in a professional's career is starting a new job. Isn’t it? It means implementing a new strategy or organizational structure, understanding the varied expectations, navigating internal processes and policies and building networks and relationships to ensure success. 

Our JCRD New Employee Onboarding Program is here for help!

Coming from the “Get Ready to Start” virtual workshop on Jun 30, where you set yourself up for success by learning essential JCRD processes and policies, we are pleased to invite you to a "Begin Making an Impact" Virtual workshop via Zoom on Jul 14. 

Join us to interact with Jianing, Head of China C-CDTL Unit, have a full picture of J&J and Janssen R&D – our organization, culture and benefits, feel part of our community and meet other new staff!

Below is the agenda of the upcoming workshop for your reference. 

 

Wish you all the success and look forward to your contribution to China R&D!

 

Any questions, please feel free to contact China R&D Learning <mailto:RA-JNJCNMP-RNDLearn@ITS.JNJ.com>  at any time.

 

Kind regards,

Your Janssen China R&D Training Team

 

Agenda  

Date: Jul 14, 2022

Time: 8:00 - 11:45

Agenda: 

Time

Topic 

Speaker

8:00 - 8:05

Welcome and Introduction

Eiffel Liu

8:05 - 9:00

Janssen R&D Overview

Jianing Di

9:00 - 9:30

Xian Janssen

Jennifer Yao

9:30 - 10:00

J&J Overview and Knowledge Contest

Eiffel Liu

10:00 - 10:15

Break

10:15 - 11:00

Our Credo and Janssen R&D Culture Drivers

Yuhan Huang

Jennifer Yao

11:00 - 11:40

Organization and Talent Development

Daisy Chen

Jennifer Yao

11:40 - 11:45

Wrap up & Session Close

Eiffel Liu

Meeting ID: 937 9773 8393

Password: 034990

Description:
Ciao tutti!

 

Please join Massimo Raineri and Giacomo Ricca as they share with us some of the innovations they’ve been working on in eBIS:

*	Massimo will discuss PhysIQ, a centralized data storage location enabling Janssen to analyze, visualize and monitor the clinical data collected from sensor devices utilized during clinical trials. 
*	Giacomo’s topic is Tokenization and how that will be used to enrich clinical trials with RWD – Real World Data. 

 

The meeting will be recorded.

 

Happy Programming to all!

Phyllis

Subject: The R Adoption Series - Using R in Regulatory Review
Meeting Organizer: The R Consortium - R Adoption Series
Required Attendees: Chen, Yufan [JRDCN]
Description:
In this R adoption seminar, we will invite three FDA staff sharing their experiences in using R in regulatory review. 

The session will start with Tae Hyun (Ryan) Jung sharing his experience in reviewing an R-based sNDA submission as a statistical reviewer. 

Following Ryan’s presentation, Hyo Soo Cho will share her experience in reviewing the submission pilot 1 conducted by the R consortium R submission working group. The last section of this event will be a panel discussion between Tae Hyun (Ryan) Jung, Hye Soo Cho and Paul Schuette. 

The audience will also have the opportunity to ask questions through the live poll during the event.

《超级教练》直播-成长自我 
 
作为公司Credo in Action的行动计划， 杨森中国及杨森中国研发管理层一起践行Credo in Action，携手在组织内部推动Coaching文化，持续通过“超级教练”提升带人经理的辅导能力，同时在第二季度推出了《与教练有约》项目。
 
《与教练有约》项目的开展得到了员工的积极反响，来自于杨森中国管理层、杨森中国研发管理层以及经过教练系统培训认证的HR、培训师为员工带来了100+次专属教练对话，让很多员工体验了什么是教练对话，并通过教练对话得到了启发和思考，通过自身找到了解决方案，并将为之付诸行动。 
 
在教练对话中，我们发现职业发展成为非常热门的教练对话议题；为了更好地帮助大家对于教练对话有更深入的了解，以及辅助员工做好职业规划，我们特别安排了《超级教练》直播，邀请大咖和大家一一讲解并进行分享，直播过程中还有彩蛋环节，请大家提前预留时间，敬请关注！

Credo in Action小组

Description:
Dear Colleagues,

 

You are invited to our a BTMT Session featuring the Strategic Business Operations Organization. As a reminder, the BTMT Events are 2-hour, interactive ZOOM Webinars with a re-occurring agenda, open to Global Development (and broader R&D) internal employees. On September 13, 2022 and from 8 to 10 am EST, we will focus on who we are, what we do, and clarify our interactions with other GD functions and stakeholders. 

 

We are looking forward to your active participation!

 

The BTMT with SBO Organizing Committee

Description:
IDAR C&SP
Janssen SAS User's Group (JSUG)

Dear IDAR Colleagues,


Please join us as we kick-off the new Janssen SAS Users’ Group (JSUG) on July, 25th at 08.00h am EST!

Hear from Janssen & SAS Executives, as well as learn more about how Clinical & Statistical Programming groups are using SAS (LSAF & SPACE).


*	Janssen Executives

 
 
 
 



*	SAS Executive
Bryan Harris, Executive Vice President & Chief Technology Officer 


JSUG will be a place for you to get together virtually to discuss data usage, exchange ideas and improve organizational knowledge, methods, and practices. 

It will be a place where you can sharpen your skills & learn more about SAS technology.

Subject: Join us for an Engaging Men As Allies WLI session with APAC leaders
Required Attendees: DL-China All Users
Description:
<https://iqmejr.stripocdn.email/content/guids/CABINET_b05bab3627d50af7b3ea08d76503bc7f/images/jnj_familyofcompanies_email_2.png>  


	
Asia Pacific 

  



Dear Asia Pacific Colleagues,

Did you know that when men are deliberately engaged in gender-inclusion ​programs, 96% of women in those organisations perceive real progress in gender equality, compared with only 30% of women in organisations without strong male engagement?*​ 

Click on the following link to join the session:

https://jnjmeetings.zoom.us/j/94494900784?pwd=Z2hHR3NOelljZTB4cjNLOThjNEkxdz09 <https://jnjmeetings.zoom.us/j/94494900784?pwd=Z2hHR3NOelljZTB4cjNLOThjNEkxdz09> 

 

We invite you to join us via live stream on Wednesday 27 July from 1-2pm SGT, for a panel discussion on Gender equality in career advancements and engaging men as allies with: 





6 Things you can do to be an Ally for Women 



We look forward to seeing you at the session, 



* https://hbr.org/2018/10/how-men-can-become-better-allies-to-women <https://hbr.org/2018/10/how-men-can-become-better-allies-to-women>

Description:
A separate meeting invitation is being sent to Non J&J Employees

 

For Valos, Cytel and IQVIA MBSM leadership receiving this invite: please forward this invite to all your MBSM associates

 

IDAR C&SP

 

C&SP Communications – SPACE Walk/Talk 

 

Dear SPACE Explorers,

 

Thank you for your participation and interactions in our SPACE sessions.
More than 240 colleagues have now been granted SPACE production access, so the need to go in more detail on SPACE items & Business Process updates related to SPACE is even bigger than before.

Note that the info provided in these communications is not covered in the standard SPACE Training.

 

On the SPACE portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/SPACE_COMM/SitePages/SPACE-Walk-%26-Talks.aspx>  via the SPACE Walk & Talk tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/SPACE_COMM/SitePages/SPACE-Walk-%26-Talks.aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics that are in a waiting list to be planned
*	the topics for the next SPACE Walk & Talk sessions
*	the topics that were covered in previous sessions
	(on the right hand side of the page there is a folder for each session holding the presentations and the recordings of the session)

 

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our SPACE Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx>  in advance.


We encourage you to visit our refreshed SPACE Portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/SPACE_COMM>  to get familiar with SPACE. Please note that the SPACE Training assignments are prioritized based on the SPACE migration/start-up strategy. 

 

Explorers can choose between the APAC/EU and US session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation.

C&SP Communications – SPACE Walk/Talk 

 

Dear SPACE Explorers,

 

Thank you for your participation and interactions in our SPACE sessions.
More than 240 colleagues have now been granted SPACE production access, so the need to go in more detail on SPACE items & Business Process updates related to SPACE is even bigger than before.

Note that the info provided in these communications is not covered in the standard SPACE Training.

 

On the SPACE portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/SPACE_COMM/SitePages/SPACE-Walk-%26-Talks.aspx>  via the SPACE Walk & Talk tile <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/SPACE_COMM/SitePages/SPACE-Walk-%26-Talks.aspx>  you can take a look at 

*	the topics that are in a waiting list to be planned
*	the topics for the next SPACE Walk & Talk sessions
*	the topics that were covered in previous sessions
	(on the right hand side of the page there is a folder for each session holding the presentations and the recordings of the session)

 

You will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions but please also log your questions through our SPACE Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx>  in advance.


We encourage you to visit our refreshed SPACE Portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/SPACE_COMM>  to get familiar with SPACE. Please note that the SPACE Training assignments are prioritized based on the SPACE migration/start-up strategy. 

 

Explorers can choose between the APAC/EU and US session for each occurrence. We look forward to your participation.

Subject: R Sharing Session for the Kenward-Rogers adjustment in the MMRM analysis
Required Attendees: Wang, Sheng-Wei [JRDUS];Karcher, Keith [JRDUS];Li, Xiang [JRDUS];Qi, Mia [JRDUS];Wang, Biju (Ryan) [JRDUS];Idokogi, Jada [JRDUS];Lu, Wentao [JRDUS];Jiang, Serene (Lingjing) [JRDUS];Jiang, Gigi [JRDUS];Bai, Daisy [JRDUS];Sha, Linlin [JRDCN];Gymnopoulou, Efi [JANBE];Ernault, Etienne [JRDNL];Weng, Stephen [JRDGB];Papadopoulou, Pelagia alexandra [RNDBE];Yuan, Linshan   [JRDUS];Abgrall, Guillaume [ACTCH];Todd, Simon [JRDUS NON-J&J];Van Dyck, Jeroen [JRDBE];Chen, Yufan [JRDCN];Hsiao, Ching-han [JRDCN];Pei, Yinghua [JRDCN];Cheng, Changchun (Alex) [JRDCN];Park, Daniel [JRDUS];Miryalkar, Manjula [JRDUS];Vengala, Kishore [JRDUS];You, Yingshan [JRDUS]
Optional Attendees: Xu, Weiwei [JRDUS];Ma, Qing (Gina) [JRDCN];Xiang, Wei [JRDCN NON-J&J];Wang, Zhuoyuan [JRDCN];Liu, He [JRDCN];Lin, Tammy [JRDCN NON-J&J]
Description:
Dear all,

 

Please kindly accept this meeting invitation that Keith (Stat Lead of the NS M281-011 study) will share with us the R implementation of the Kenward-Rogers adjustment in the MMRM analysis. This sharing session will be the add-on to the MMRM training that Serene and Alex provided in May.

 

The talk will be recorded,  for those who can’t join can access the material in their leisure time after the meeting.  

 

Thanks,

Sheng-Wei

Description:
Dear all,

We are glad to invite you to join us for the first TrialViz (https://ds.apcoe-ts.jnj.com.cn/trialviz) training.  

We’re pleased to have Jenny Zheng, Head of Asia Pacific Center of Excellence in Translational Science and Mingyi Sun, Head of GCO China to give an opening followed by a comprehensive training. Hao Zhan from AP COE-TS Data Science team will give an introduction to this new platform and walk you through some use cases. By the end of the training, we hope you can see the practical benefits you can get from TrialViz.

Activity

Speaker

13:30- 13:40

Opening

Jenny Zheng

Mingyi Sun

13:40- 14:20

TrialViz Introduction

Hao Zhan

14:20- 14:30

Q&A

All

Come and join us! Looking forward to your attendance. 

TrialViz Team

Subject: Translational Science Driving Transformative Medicine Seminar Series | 4th Session
Required Attendees: DL-DPDS-TD-Discovery Chemistry CN;DL-GD-GCO-China-JNJ;DL-GD-SDS-CN ALL;DL-JNJCNMP-JRDCNChina-CMC@ITS.JNJ.com;DL-JRDCN AP CoE All;DL-JRDCN Business Partners All;DL-JRDCN C&G All;DL-JRDCN C-CDTL Unit All;DL-JRDCN China R&D Administrators;DL-JRDCN China R&D Core SLT;DL-JRDCN China R&D People Managers;DL-JRDCN China R&D SLT;DL-JRDCN Clinical Development All;DL-JRDCN Clinical Pharmacology All;DL-JRDCN DM All;DL-JRDCN DPC;DL-JRDCN EO All;DL-JRDCN GRA All;DL-JRDCN HGR & BO All;DL-JRDCN JCRD CMT;DL-JRDCN JCRD Hosted Functions All;DL-JRDCN MAO All;DL-JRDCN MWLS All;DL-JRDCN PDO All;DL-JRDCN PMO ALL;DL-JRDCN PSTS All;DL-JRDCN Regulatory Affairs All;DL-JRDCN SP&A All;JCRD HCC [JRDCN];Liu, Yiyao (Yolanda) [JANCNBJ NON J&J];Yang, Fan [JRDCN]
Description:
Following the previous insightful presentation brought by global leaders from Neuroscience Discovery & Translational Science on Precision Neuroscience, we are honored to invite Professor Tianmei Si, Director of Department of Clinical Psychopharmacology, Peking University Institute of Mental Health, as the speaker for the upcoming 4th Session of “Translational Science Driving Transformative Medicine” Seminar Series. 

On August 26th, Professor Tianmei Si, will share with us her research option and expertise on the impact of psychosocial factors on the occurrence and development of mental disease Mental disease from KOL’s angle. We are looking forward to your participation to this scientific presentation and discussion. 

Fourth Session:

Topic: 社会心理因素对精神疾病发生发展的影响                                                                        

The impact of psychosocial factors on the occurrence and development of mental disease

Date & Time: Friday, August 26th, 2022 09:00-10:00 (Beijing time)

 

Speaker



 

Prof. Tianmei Si 

Director of Department of Clinical Psychopharmacology, Peking University Institute of Mental Health

Join from a Meeting Room

*	Join the Zoom meeting from your laptop using the meeting URL in the invite. Do NOT join audio from your computer.
*	Select the 'Phone Call' tab (Make a note of Meeting ID and Participant ID).
*	Dial one of the telephone numbers listed.
*	When prompted, enter the Meeting ID followed by #.
*	When prompted, enter your Participant ID (Do NOT "just press # to continue").
*	You will be joined into the meeting.

 

Get interactive with Zoom

Zoom has a number of ways to bring interactivity into a virtual meeting, such as screen sharing, chat, polls, Q&A and more. Learn more about Zoom on ITforME <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/itformeportal/Pages/Zoom.aspx> .

 

ALL J&J USERS of Zoom for Business Meetings, in particular Meeting Hosts, are required to understand Zoom security options and to follow the J&J Usage Requirements for Zoom <https://jnjprod.service-now.com/iris?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB000010107537> . Use of Zoom for sharing any highly sensitive or personal health information should be avoided unless carefully following the Usage Requirements. Additionally, Zoom allows J&J meeting presenters to optionally record audio and other information shared during the meeting session. If a meeting presenter wishes to utilize the recording feature, the presenter should notify participants at the beginning of the meeting. If you do not consent to being recorded, please discuss your concerns with the meeting organizer either prior to or at the beginning of the meeting, or do not join the meeting. To ensure meeting confidentiality, please do NOT share meeting URLs and always confirm participants prior to the start of your meeting.
